info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 4:52PM EDT until September 24 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following county, Schoharie.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Though the heaviest rainfall has moved out of the Advisory area, additional showers with possible moderate downpours could occur over the next hour according to latest radar trends. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jefferson, Summit, Arabia, Baird Corners, East Jefferson, Lutheranville, Vorman Corners, Charlotteville, Eminence, Beards Hollow and West Jefferson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING
